modules.title: Cryptanalysis Fundamentals
modules.content:
## Breaking Cryptography

### Attack Types
- Brute force
- Dictionary attacks
- Side-channel attacks
- Mathematical weaknesses

### Weak Algorithms
- DES (56-bit key)
- MD5 (collisions)
- SHA-1 (deprecated)
- RC4 (biases)

modules.title: Hash Collision Attacks
modules.content:
## Collision Attacks

### Birthday Attack
Find two inputs with same hash.

### MD5 Collisions
```bash
# Create colliding PDFs
hashclash -c md5 file1.pdf file2.pdf
```

### Real-World Impact
- Flame malware
- Certificate forgery

modules.title: Password Attack Techniques
modules.content:
## Advanced Password Cracking

### Rule-Based Attacks
```bash
hashcat -m 0 -a 0 hashes.txt wordlist.txt -r rules/best64.rule
```

### Mask Attacks
```bash
hashcat -m 0 -a 3 hashes.txt ?u?l?l?l?d?d?d
```

### Combinator
```bash
hashcat -m 0 -a 1 hashes.txt words1.txt words2.txt
```

modules.title: Cryptographic Implementation Flaws
modules.content:
## Implementation Vulnerabilities

### Common Flaws
- Weak random numbers
- Key reuse
- Padding oracle
- Timing attacks

### Example: ECB Mode
- Same plaintext = same ciphertext
- Pattern leakage
- Always use CBC/GCM
